transcript: de- parture Hlene returned to Petersburg, she was received by all her acquaintances not only cordially, but even with a shade of deference due to her misfortune. When conversation turned on her husband Hlene assumed a dig- nified expression, which with characteristic tact she had acquired though she did not un- derstand its significance. This expression sug- gested that she had resolved to endure her troubles uncomplainingly and that her hus- band was a cross laid upon her by God. Prince Vasfli
